channel.title: Yeongdong-gun on Every Corner of Korea

item.title: Colorful fruit country, Yeongdong, Chungbuk - Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, Korea
item.description:
Pizza making experience

Colorful fruit country, Yeongdong, Chungbuk

Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, Korea

<Full travel path>
Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm (Yeongdong Cheese Camp) → 8 minutes by car 3.7km → Nogunri Peace Park → 11 minutes by car 6.4km → Wine Korea → 9 minutes by car 5.6km → Fruit Nara Theme Park → 14 minutes by car 11.6km → Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village (Nakye Gugak Performance, Gugak Experience, Nangye Gugak Museum)
The cold wind blows winter. I don't want to slump in the hot bottom quilt, but the child is different. Children who want to play so that the ball becomes red, hold the parents' sleeves to the front door. At this time, let's plan a winter family trip to Yeongdong, Chungbuk without worry. Located at the foot of the Chubaeknyeong Mountain in the Sobaek Mountain Range, Yeongdong is famous for its high fruit sugar content as a regional feature with large daily intersections. In summer, peaches and grapes, and in autumn, apples, persimmons, and pears, if you add 'Yeongdong' to the name of the fruit, it is a fruit country. So it's easy to think that there are no things to see or eat in a frozen winter, but you are welcome. Winter in Yeongdong is full of experiences for children. At Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm, you can meet lovely flower deer in front of you and spend 2 days and 1 night in a variety of experiences. Enjoy the wine bath experience in Wine Korea, representing the hometown of grapes and wine, and the rare experience of ringing the world's largest drum in Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village. Let's build happy memories this winter in Yeongdong, Chungbuk.
Full of fun all day, Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm
Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm, located in Hwanggan-myeon, Yeongdong, Chungbuk, is a place where family-level travelers visit all seasons with various experience programs. The moon is also on the way to Wolyubong, so it's okay to look around.
Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm Cafe
The large plantation is equipped with facilities such as seminar rooms, experience centers, pensions, cafés, and football courts, so you can spend your time with a two-day, one-night course. The interior of the cafe decorated with the theme of deer is also impressive.
Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm
The first course is to observe deer. "Mom! They look like Rudolph! ”The children are excited. In December of Christmas, Rudolph, who delivers Santa's grandfather's gift box, is actually a reindeer, not a deer. A child who doesn't know about this looks at a deer and is delighted to receive a gift right away.
Deer on the bridge
Deer have only male horns, and reindeer females are more unpretentious than males, but both have horns. As you climb over the bridge where you can meet deer at the plantation, deer pluck their ears to the people's popularity. As a feeding experience, let's take a step closer to a deer with slender, long legs and beautiful patterns.
Flower
Deer feeding experience requires some attention. The deer who live in a group are crowded and alert. This is because in the wild, they are weaker than animals such as lions and tigers.
Deer Feeding Experience
so You should wait quietly in front of the feeder until the deer clears the border and comes close. Children should be told not to scream or move.
Deer Feeding Experience Feed
The child breathes and waits for the deer to interact. It is a special experience because it is different from a zoo in a cage that eats just as it feeds. When you see a child interacting with an animal, you will be proud of the idea that 'it's good!'
Family feeding experience
The “deer bulgogi pizza making experience” is popular among family travelers who come with their children.
Pizza making experience
This is because you can make pizza and eat your own pizza right there.
Completed Venison Bulgogi Pizza
Spread the dough in a circle with a stick, spread the tomato sauce over the dough, and then topped with various ingredients such as mozzarella cheese, venison bulgogi, black olives, and mushrooms.
Pizza topping
After 15 minutes, tasting the pizza and spaghetti coming out of the oven will solve the children's lunch. Even children who do not like vegetables taste their own pizza and enjoy healthy pizza.
Pizza baked in the oven
Deer antler ice cream making experience
After making pizza, the ice cream making experience continues. Can I make ice cream without a refrigerator? The answer is YES! Milk, salt, and ice are all possible. Children are curious about being a delicious ice cream with common ingredients. Especially, antler extract was added here to add healthy ingredients to ice cream.
Making antler ice cream
It's simple to make. In a bowling ball-shaped ice cream maker, add white milk, antler extract, and chocolate. Fill it with ice and salt and shake it hard to complete healthy ice cream! When you shake your body to the exciting music, it becomes a delicious ice cream. It is a natural ice cream without chemical additives, so it is safe for children to eat.
Deer antler ice cream tasting
The last course is the cheese making experience. Here, 'Imsil Cheese' is used, which is as famous as any other brand.
Cheese making experience
A solid chunk of cheese is given, and the children tear the cheese and soak it in warm water to dissolve it.
Cheese melting
The last step in the process of making cheese is to make the cheese sue. Children's elasticity is stretched with cheese. The cheese can be packaged and taken home.
Cheese Stretch
You can also enjoy a variety of food at the deer farm.
Deer bulgogi
There are a variety of menus such as deer meat sashimi, deer meat sashimi, stir-fried deer bulgogi, and deer mochi ribs, so that both adults and children can enjoy nutritious deer meat without refusal.
Venison yukhoe
World Human Rights Peace Ground, No Gun-ri Peace Park
No Gun-ri Peace Park is about a 10-minute drive from Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm. This is the scene of the No Gun Ri incident, which remains as a big scar in Korean modern history. It is also called the No Gun Ri massacre, and in July 1950, just after the Korean War broke out, the US military killed 250 innocent Korean refugees under the No Gun Ri railway bridge.
Nogunri Peace Park
This event, which was almost buried in history, became known to the world as a persistent truth-finding activity by survivors for over 50 years, and related laws were enacted in 2004. In addition, it created a peace park in 2011 to re-examine the sad history.
Memorial tower
The Peace Park, which covers a size of 13,240 square meters (about 40,000 pyeong), includes the Peace Memorial Hall, the Memorial Hall of Memorial, the Sculpture Park, and the Life Hall, which features the 1950s.
Memories of Life
In the Peace Memorial Museum, there are exhibits that can examine the entire picture of the No Gun Ri incident. If you look at the exhibits, you will naturally walk towards the tower of the spirits due to unhappiness and regret.
Peace Memorial Hall
The role of an adult's story bag is important in a trip with a child who is still unable to read and understand alone. Let's try an emotional sympathy to understand the pain of someone with the child, while easily explaining the concept of peace to the children.
Peace Memorial Hall
Across the road from the Peace Park, there is the Ssanggul Bridge, the site of the No Gun Ri incident.
Double-legged bridge
The No Gun-ri Ssanggul Bridge was built as a railway bridge for the Gyeongbu Line in 1934. If you look closely at the two arched bridges, the bullet marks still remain clear. The child looked at the bullet marks in the circle and seemed to feel that it was a sad scene, although not sure.
Double-legged bullet marks
Hot wine foot bath experience, Wine Korea
The fruit that comes to mind in Yeongdong is 'grape'. Yeongdong, Chungbuk, is Korea's largest grape producing region, accounting for 12.7% of the nation's grape production. In the summer, Yeongdong is excited by the purple grape festival, but there are many wines that can enjoy the sweet grape flavor even in winter. Currently, there are over 50 winery farmhouses in Yeongdong. Let's go to Wine Korea. The cold winter wine foot bath experience melts the fatigue accumulated during the trip.
Wine Korea
Wine Korea was renovated in 1996 and was first established under the name of “Yeongdong Podo Farming Association”, and in 2004, it was renamed Wine Korea and became a joint-stock company with hundreds of farmers growing Yeongdong Podo.
Wine cellar
From the process of cultivating grapes to manufacturing, storing, and selling wine, everything related to Yeongdong grapes is managed by one stop, and the facilities in the space are diverse. From the basement wine cellar using crypts used as ammunition during the Japanese colonial period to wine bars, galleries, and private wine sellers, there are many different things to see and it is fun to see.
Yeongdong grape cultivation map
The wine foot bath experience is the highlight. Change to the slippers provided in the dressing room, go down to the foot bath, and rinse your feet first with water from Hamji Park.
Wine foot bath
If you soak your feet in diluted hot spring water, your fatigue will be relieved.
Wine foot bath experience
A private foot bath is also available for children who can't reach their feet. The temperature of the general foot bath is hot for the child, so you can enjoy it by setting the temperature with cold water to match the temperature of the child. At first, he is unfamiliar, but he is happy to apply water to his knees.
Wine foot bath experience
In the wine bath, the polyphenol and anthocyanin components of grapes help skin beauty, and are effective in alleviating neuralgia and arthritis, blood circulation and fatigue recovery. The experience time is about 25 minutes.
Foot bath experience and wine tasting
Full of fresh fruit scent, Fruit Nara Theme Park
From the seed to the fruit to the fruit we taste, the fruit country theme park is where you can experience the farmer's sincerity. Opened in April 2017, it is the only theme park in Korea with fruit theme. On the site of 77,950㎡ (about 23,000 pyeong), there are fruit trees such as grapes, apples, pears, peaches, and enjoy various cooking experiences including harvesting. You can. The fruit harvesting experience is from July to October, but other cooking and processing experiences are available in all seasons. However, you can use it only by making a reservation through the website 5 days ago.
Fruit Nara Theme Park Learning Center
In the fruit promotion hall inside the learning hall, you can take a closer look at the fruits produced in Yeongdong.
Fruit promotion hall for children's eye level
Which grape is sweet? The more white the egg is full and the more sugar is leaked, the sweeter it is, and the more grape grapes go down, the stronger the sour taste.
Processing experience room to dry persimmon
The story of foxes, grapes, and the monkey's ass are displayed on the theme of “fruits” such as red, so children can enjoy watching them.
Children's Playground in the Learning Center
The world's largest drum, the celestial elevation
Yeongdong is the hometown of the world's top three malignant teachers, Yeon Park, along with Silla's Wusheng and Goguryeo's Wang Sanak.
Nanggye Gugak Experience Village Cheongo Tabuk
So, Yeongdong serves as a hometown for promoting Korean traditional music, and various experiences and exhibitions are provided. It is a representative space where the Korean traditional music experience village located in Shenzhen-myeon can properly experience the “our voice”.
Heaven
The Gugak Experience Village consists of 3 buildings with 1 floor underground and 2 floors above ground on a site of 75,000 square meters. There is a 300-seat performance hall, an experience room, and a “Gak-ak Nuri Pavilion”, a lodging space where 200 visitors can experience Korean music at once.
Celestial pattern
In particular, the world's largest drum, 5.54m in diameter and 7 tons in weight, is located here. That is 'Cheongo', the world's largest drum listed in the Guinness Book of Records in 2011. You can also try hitting the heavens as if they were thundering.
Sound Creation Center
At the Nanggye Gugak Museum, located 400 meters from the Gugak Experience Village, you can explore various stories related to Gugak.
Miniature making experience
Every Saturday at 3 pm, the Nanggye Gugak performances are held to add to the sights. The Nanggye Gugak, the nation's only military gugak group, offers not only Jeongak but also various fusion Korean classical music, so it is a good idea to refer to it when traveling.
I...
Travel information

Recommended travel course (same day course)

Day 1: Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm (Yeongdong Cheese Camp) → Wine Korea → Fruit Nara Theme Park → Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village (Nanggye Gugak Museum)


Recommended travel course (2 days and 1 night course)

Day 1: Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm (Yeongdong Cheese Camp) → Nogunri Peace Park → Okgye Falls → Wine Korea
Day 2: Fruit Nara Theme Park → Songho National Tourist Site → Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village


question

-Chungpungryeong Deer Tourist Farm (Yeongdong Cheese Camp): 50-42, Ucheon 1-gil, Hwanggan-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, 04-745-4343

-Nogunri Peace Park: 7 Mokhwasil-gil, Hwanggan-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-744-1941 / http://nogunri.yd21.go.kr/html/kr/

-Fruit National Theme Park: 248 Yeongdong Healing-ro, Yeongdong-eup, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-740-3651 ~ 3 / http://ht.yd21.go.kr/fruit/

-Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village: 33, Gugak-ro 1-gil, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-740-3891 / http://gugak.yd21.go.kr/

-Wine Korea: 662 Yeongdong Hwanggan-ro, Yeongdong-eup, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-744-3211 / www.winekorea.kr/

-Yeongdong-gun Cultural Tourism: 043-740-3114 / http://tour.yd21.go.kr/

-Yeongdong-gun official blog https://ydpodoblog.blog.me/


Barrier-free information


-Chupungryeong Deer Tourist Farm (Yeongdong Cheese Camp)
* There is no separate nursing room, but there are many pensions and rest areas, so it can be used.
* Stroller can be moved


-Nogunri Peace Park

* Operating Hours: March ~ October 09: 30 ~ 17: 30, November ~ February 10: 00 ~ 17: 00

* Closed: Every Monday, January 1, Lunar New Year's Day, Chuseok holidays (open on holidays). However, outdoor exhibitions, sculpture parks, Memorial Towers, etc. are open (open year-round)

* Fee: Free

* There is a shelter in the visitor center

* You can enter the Memorial Hall with a stroller


-Fruit Nara Theme Park

* Operating hours: 09:30 ~ 17:50

* Closed: Every Monday (the following day if Monday is a public holiday), January 1, Chuseok and New Year holidays

* Fee: Free of charge (※ Experience fee is separate-Harvesting experience is available for family units. Cooking and processing experience can be applied for groups of 20 or more)

* Reservation must be made 5 days in advance


-Wine Korea

* Winery Tour Hours: Tue ~ Sat 9: 00 ~ 18: 00 (advance reservation)

* Closed: Sundays and Mondays

※ On Saturdays, guided tours are not available due to the wine train package schedule. Autonomous viewing only

* Wine foot bath experience fee: 5,000 won per person


-Yeongdong Gugak Experience Village

* Hours: 09: 00 ~ 18: 00 (open year-round)

* Permanent performance: Every Saturday 15:00, Venue: Gugak Experience Village, Woori Sori Hall

* Experience program: Korean musical instrument performance experience, Korean classical music costume experience, Korean musical instrument production experience (reservation), etc.

* Lodging program: Traditional culture experience retreat

* Strollers can use the ramp


-Nanggye Gugak Museum

* Hours: 09: 00 ~ 18: 00

* Closed: Every Monday, January 1, Chuseok holidays

* Fee: 2,000 won for adults, free for children under 6

Move information
Public transportation information

-[Bus] Operates three times a day (10:00, 14:00, 18:00) from Seoul-Yeongdong (Okcheon) and Dong Seoul General Terminals. It takes about 2 hours and 30 minutes.

* Inquiries: Dong Seoul General Terminal 1688-5979 / www.ti21.co.kr


-[Train] Seoul Station-Yeongdong Station (Transfer to Daejeon Station) KTX, Mugunghwa Lake, Saemaul Lake 25 times a day (05: 56 ~ 22: 55), 2 hours 20 minutes-2 hours 40 minutes. * Inquiries: Letsko Rail 1544-7788 / www.letskorail.com


Self-driving information

-From Seoul: Gyeongbu Expressway → Yeongdong IC → Yeongdong

-From Busan: Gyeongbu Expressway → Hwanggan IC → To Yeongdong

-From Gwangju: Honam Expressway → Seodaejeon JC → Daejeon Nambu Beltway → Yeongdong IC → Yeongdong

Food and lodging information

Rooms

-Democratic Jisan Natural Recreation Forest : 60 Yonghwa recreational forest road, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-740-3437 / http://minjoo.cbhuyang.go.kr/

-Gugak Nuri Hall in Gugak Experience Village : 33, Gugak-ro 1-gil, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungcheongbuk-do / 043-740-3891


Restaurants near

-Deokseunggwan : Unijajang / 5 Sogye-ro, Hwanggan-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-742-4122

-Daedong Mushroom Hand Kalguksu : Tricolor Mushroom Kalguksu / 29, Gugak-ro, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-745-6617

-Gasun Restaurant : Eojuk / 760, Geumgang-ro, Yangsan-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk / 043-743-8665


※ The above information was updated in November 2018, and may be changed later, so be sure to check it before you travel.
※ Information, such as text, photos, and videos used in this article, is copyrighted by the Korea Tourism Organization, and unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.

item.title: Youngdong Shenzhen-ri Village, the hometown of the heart when we miss the countryside - Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, South Korea
item.description:
Small station with impressive green roof, Shenzhen Station

Youngdong Shenzhen-ri Village, the hometown of the heart when we miss the countryside

Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk, South Korea

"I want to go back!" There are times when anyone wants to go somewhere, like the lines in a movie. At any point in the past, or anywhere in the past, there are times when you will be reminded of your memories. Especially when a big holiday is over. When the word family and home come to mind, busy hands are slowly turning upside down.
A simple station where memories live and the town scenery spread out like a black and white photo
But going back in time is not easy. As time goes by, the appearance of hometown is changing. In the meantime, there are some places that retain their former appearances as if they were passing away. If you want to go back to a moment in the past, take a slow train to Shenzhen station in Yeongdong, Chungbuk.
Shenzhen Station is a small convenience station. The station was opened as a regular station in 1905. The station has been newly built and moved to Gyeongbu Line double track construction in 1934. The history of the 1930s was preserved in the original form of the gable roof and was designated as Registered Cultural Property No. 297 in 2006. When you get off at the small station, you can see the green roof and the words 'the station where the old memories stay'. There are not many people getting on the train and getting off. The scent of dull feelings abounds in history and railroad tracks. The waiting room is small too.
"Once there were a lot of passengers and bustling times. The market was activated and many people gathered, but now it's a very quiet station." The station worker looks at the empty waiting room and explains the old look of Shenzhen Station.
Simple Shenzhen Station Waiting Room
Exiting the waiting room leads to the station square. The square is quite wide compared to the small train station. It is not only the station that Shenzhen has gone through.
Old drugstore centered on the station square
Right in front of the train station is an old pharmacy called Supergang Pharmacy, and at the entrance to the plaza there are two stores that have annual rings instead of common convenience stores. It's like a movie set set in the 1970s.
Old commercial center centered on the station square
The view inside the drugstore is also nice. Bacchus boxes are lined up. Even if there is no sore place, I want to make a ping pong and cross the threshold once.
A video store that brings memories
In front of 'Brother's Club' and 'Reverse Chamber of Commerce' there are beautiful trees. Underneath, a few of my grandmothers are chatting together. It is the scenery of a rural village that I remembered when I was young. Miraculous. Is time passing by here at a different speed?
Membrane Mill
There are shops and houses along the two-lane road along the Brotherhood. There is a cotton office, a restaurant, a pesticide shop and a mill. The neighborhood where Shenzhen Station is located is Shenzhen-li, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungbuk. It was hard to imagine the bustle of the past without the guidance of a station worker in Shenzhen, who once said that it was a busy and noisy neighborhood. The neighborhood was quiet.
An iron gate is also a medium for memories
"Oh, is this store closed today? You have to open the doors on Saturdays to help the farmers with their farming." This conversation is coming and going. The voices of the uncles on the road can be heard across the street. When someone passes by, they pretend to know and talk with each other.
An iron gate is also a medium for memories
Take a picture of a rusty fence in front of a farm machinery store. A faded video store signage is also pictured. Lack of scenery seems to be warming somewhere. "What do you use to write it?" The uncle who passes by throws a horse. I'm glanced at doing something really useless. Yeah. The scenes were common 20-20 years ago, but now it's amazing that I'm trying to capture every single camera.
The friendly scenery you encounter as you walk slowly through the town
Sometimes the bus, sometimes a car, and the words 'slowly' written on a quiet road are noticeable. Yes, sometimes it's good to go slowly in either side of the world.
The word 'slowly' written on the road sticks to my heart
Add beautiful sound to your memories trip, Yeongdong Gugak Village
It doesn't take long to get around the neighborhood around Shenzhen Station. If you want to spend more time here, take a bike hire from Shenzhen station. It is also known as 'blue bike'. Passengers traveling to Shenzhen on a train can travel for free. You can ride a bicycle along the nearby river or explore the nearby attractions.
If you visit Shenzhen by train, you can use the bicycle for free.
One course (8.1km) to Okgye Falls, two courses (9.4km) to Iwon Bridge, and three courses (5.8km) to Yeongdong Gugak Village.
Yeongdong Shenzhen-myeon, North Chungcheong Province is famous for the hometown of Nanji Park.
Now that we came to Shenzhen-myeon, Yeong-dong, Chungbuk, which is the hometown of the Nangye Park Yeon, one of the three malice in Korea, let's head to the Yeongdong Gugak Village. Yeongdong Gugak Village has Cheongogak along with facilities such as performance halls and experience rooms. The Cheongogak is the largest drum in the world, and is the space where the Cheongo is registered. The ceiling is 7 tons in weight, with a diameter of 5.54m, a diameter of 6.4m and a width of 5.96m.
Yeongdong Gugak Village, a free performance of Korean traditional music every Saturday
If you want to make full use of Yeongdong Gugak Village, visit on Saturday. This is because the permanent performance of Nanji Gugak Orchestra is held every Saturday. You can enjoy a variety of genres, from authentic Korean traditional music to fusion. During the performance, a description of Korean musical instruments may be given. There is also a space where you can touch the lyre, gayageum, and janggu at the entrance. After listening to the Korean traditional music performances, we will deal with musical instruments. The Korean traditional music, which felt difficult and far away, is approaching intimately.
You can play lyre, gayageum, and janggu yourself.
Near the Yeongdong Gugak Village, Nangye Gugak Museum, where materials about Korean traditional music and egg-based yeon are displayed, Nangye Family House, which is the place where Nangye Park Yeon was born. have. The journey started at Shenzhen Station, where 'old memories stay', leads to the Youngdong Gugak Village where 'old sounds stay' on a blue bicycle. Nostalgic sound is added to the nostalgic memories. Stimulates travel sensibility in autumn.
Let's visit Nangye Gugak Museum with Yeongdong Gugak Village
Travel info

Shenzhen Station
-Address: 5-1 Shenzhen-ro 5-gil, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungcheongbuk-do
Contact: 1544-7788

Yeongdong Gugak Experience Center
-Address: 33, Gugak-ro 1-gil, Shenzhen-myeon, Yeongdong-gun, Chungcheongbuk-do
Inquiries: 043-740-3891

http://gugak.yd21.go.kr/home/main.php

Restaurants near
-Elephant Dumpling: Snack / 35, Jungang-ro, Yeongdong-eup / 043-743-4165
-Songcheon Garden: Trout Sashimi, Freshwater Maetang / 793, Nam-ro, Yongsan-myeon / 043-742-8300

Rooms
Beomyeong-ru: 57, Mulhan 4-gil, Sangchon-myeon / 043-745-2628

http://blog.naver.com/bumyoungru
Standal Motel: 24, Gyesan-ro 1-gil, Yeongdong-eup / 043-744-7228
Dubai Motel: 7-1, Gyesan-ro 6-gil, Yeongdong-eup / 043-744-2235

※ The above information was updated in January 2019 and may change afterwards. Please check before traveling.
※ The information such as text, photos and videos used in this article is copyrighted by Korea Tourism Organization, so unauthorized use of the article is prohibited.
